text: Janet Teresa Moreau Stone (October 26, 1927 - June 30, 2021) was an American track and field athlete. She competed mainly in the 100 meters. She competed for the United States in the 1952 Summer Olympics held in Helsinki, Finland in the 4 x 100 meters where she won the gold medal. Stone died in Barrington, Rhode Island on June 30, 2021, at age 93.Janet Moreau's obituary ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American sprinters Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States Category:Sportspeople from Rhode Island Category:People from Pawtucket, Rhode Island
title: Janet Moreau
